intro: Rhododendron haemonium, commonly known as the common rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring dense, leathery leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, or white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils. Rhododendron haemonium is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
